Disclose all material facts to the Assessor, and not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, any fact material to the Assessor’s: (1) determination of whether Respondents have implemented and maintained the Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses; (2) assessment of the effectiveness of the Respondents’ implementation and maintenance of sub-Provisions A-O of the required Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses; or (3) identification of any gaps 23 or weaknesses in, or instances of material noncompliance with, the Mandated Information Security Program for Covered Businesses.

provisions.title: Annual Certification
provisions.summary: Respondents must provide annual certifications from their CEO (or designated senior officer) confirming compliance with the Order, absence of uncorrected material noncompliance, and describing all Covered Incidents affecting 100 or more consumers during the certified period.

requirements.description: One year after the issuance date of this Order, and each year thereafter, provide the Commission with a certification from the CEO (Mr. Jeffrey S. Stein, or his successor or designated senior officer) that: (1) each Covered Business has established, implemented, and maintained the requirements of this Order; (2) each Covered Business is not aware of any material noncompliance that has not been corrected or disclosed to the Commission; and (3) includes a brief description of all Covered Incidents affecting 100 or more consumers verified or confirmed during the certified period.
requirements.quoted_text: A. One year after the issuance date of this Order, and each year thereafter, provide the Commission with a certification from Corporate Respondents’ Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Jeffrey S. Stein, or if Mr. Stein no longer serves as Respondents’ Chief Executive Officer, President or such other officer (regardless of title) that is designated in that Respondent’s Bylaws or resolution of the Board of Directors as having the duties of the principal executive officer of Respondent, then a senior corporate manager, or, if no such senior corporate manager exists, a senior officer responsible for Respondents’ Information Security Program that: (1) each Covered Business has established, implemented, and maintained the requirements of this Order; (2) each Covered Business is not aware of any material noncompliance that has not been (a) corrected or (b) disclosed to the Commission; and (3) includes a brief description of all Covered Incidents affecting 100 or more consumers that Respondents verified or confirmed during the certified period. The certification must be based on the personal knowledge of Mr. Stein, the senior corporate manager, senior officer, or subject matter experts upon whom Mr. Stein, the senior corporate manager, or senior officer reasonably relies in making the certification.

requirements.description: Submit all annual certifications to the Commission via email to DEbrief@ftc.gov or by overnight courier to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, with subject line beginning "In re Rite Aid Corporation, FTC File No. C-4308."
requirements.quoted_text: B. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, submit all annual certifications to the Commission pursuant to this Order via email to DEbrief@ftc.gov or by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20580. The subject line must begin, “In re Rite Aid Corporation, FTC File No. C-4308.”

provisions.title: Covered Incident Reports
provisions.summary: Within 10 days of notifying any U.S. government entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents must submit a report to the Commission detailing the incident's date, facts, affected information types, number of affected consumers, remediation actions taken, and copies of consumer notices.

requirements.description: Within 10 days of any notification to a U.S. federal, state, or local entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, submit a report to the Commission including: (A) the date or estimated date range of the incident; (B) facts relating to the incident including causes and scope; (C) each type of information affected; (D) the number of consumers affected; (E) remediation actions taken and protective measures; and (F) a representative copy of each materially different notice sent to consumers or government entities.
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, within 10 days of any notification to a United States federal, state, or local entity of a Covered Incident affecting 500 or more consumers, Respondents, for any Covered Business, must submit a report to the Commission. The report must include, to the extent possible: A. The date, estimated date, or estimated date range when the Covered Incident occurred; B. A description of the facts relating to the Covered Incident, including the causes and scope of the Covered Incident, if known; C. A description of each type of information that was affected by the Covered Incident; D. The number of consumers whose information was affected by the Covered Incident; 24 E. The acts that each Covered Business has taken to date to remediate the Covered Incident and protect Covered Information from further exposure or access, and protect affected individuals from identity theft or other harm that may result from the Covered Incident; and F. A representative copy of each materially different notice sent by each Covered Business to consumers or to any U.S. federal, state, or local government entity regarding the Covered Incident.

requirements.description: Submit all Covered Incident reports to the Commission via email to DEbrief@ftc.gov or by overnight courier to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, with subject line beginning "In re Rite Aid Corporation, FTC File No. C-4308."
requirements.quoted_text: Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all Covered Incident reports to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to DEbrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20580. The subject line must begin, “In re Rite Aid Corporation, FTC File No. C-4308.”

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit their own acknowledgment of receipt within 10 days, deliver copies of the Order to current and future principals, officers, relevant employees, subsidiaries, and agents for 20 years, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient within 30 days.

requirements.description: Each Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.
requirements.quoted_text: A. Each Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, each Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all current and future subsidiaries that own, control, or operate one or more stores or online retail platforms; (3) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter; and (4) any business entity resulting from any change in structure. Delivery must occur within 10 days after the effective date for current personnel, and before others assume their responsibilities.
requirements.quoted_text: B. For twenty (20) years after the issuance date of this Order, each Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all of Respondents’ current and future subsidiaries that own, control, or operate one or more stores or online retail platforms; (3) all employees having managerial responsibilities for conduct related to the subject matter of the Order and all agents and representatives who participate in conduct related to the subject matter of the Order; and (4) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision entitled Compliance Reports and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.
requirements.deadline: 10 days for current personnel; before assuming responsibilities for others; ongoing for 20 years

requirements.description: From each individual or entity to which Respondents delivered a copy of this Order, obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondents delivered a copy of this Order, Respondents must obtain, within thirty (30) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Reports and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondents must submit an initial sworn compliance report one year after issuance, provide sworn notices within 14 days of structural or contact changes or bankruptcy filings, and submit all required documents to the Commission via specified channels.

requirements.description: One year after the issuance date of this Order, each Respondent must submit a compliance report sworn under penalty of perjury identifying designated contact information and business names, describing activities of each business, describing in detail compliance with each Provision of the Order including changes made to comply, and providing copies of all Acknowledgments obtained.
requirements.quoted_text: A. One year after the issuance date of this Order, each Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which each Respondent must: (a) 25 identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of that Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how that Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order, including a discussion of all of the changes the Respondent made to comply with the Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission;

requirements.description: Each Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in a designated point of contact or any structural change (including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of any entity) that may affect compliance obligations under the Order.
requirements.quoted_text: B. Each Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in (a) any designated point of contact; or (b) the structure of such Respondent or any entity that such Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order;

requirements.description: Each Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against such Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.
requirements.quoted_text: C. Each Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against such Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing;

requirements.description: Any submission to the Commission required to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746.
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature;

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to DEbrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, with subject line beginning "In re Rite Aid Corporation, FTC File No. C-4308".
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to DEbrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director for Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW, Washington, DC 20580. The subject line must begin: “In re Rite Aid Corporation, FTC File No. C-4308”.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondents must create certain records for 20 years after the issuance date and retain each for five years (unless otherwise specified), including accounting records, personnel records, consumer complaints, compliance records, System Assessment materials, privacy/security representations, Assessor materials, law enforcement communications, and records of non-compliance.

requirements.description: Create and retain accounting records showing revenues, costs incurred generating those revenues, and resulting net profit or loss.
requirements.quoted_text: A. Accounting records showing the revenues from all goods or services sold, the costs incurred in generating those revenues, and resulting net profit or loss;

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for each person providing services in relation to any aspect of the Order, including name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title or position, dates of service, and reason for termination.
requirements.quoted_text: B. Personnel records showing, for each person providing services in relation to any aspect of the Order, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; 26 telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain copies or records of all consumer complaints concerning the subject matter of this Order, whether received directly or indirectly, and any response.
requirements.quoted_text: C. Copies or records of all consumer complaints concerning the subject matter of this Order, whether received directly or indirectly, such as through a third party, and any response;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each Provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission.
requirements.quoted_text: D. All records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each Provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission;

requirements.description: For five (5) years after the date of preparation of each System Assessment, retain all materials relied upon to prepare the System Assessment, including all plans, test results, reports, studies, reviews, audits, policies, training materials, assessments, and any other materials concerning compliance with related Provisions.
requirements.quoted_text: E. For five (5) years after the date of preparation of each System Assessment required by this Order, all materials relied upon to prepare the System Assessment, including all plans, test results, reports, studies, reviews, audits, policies, training materials, and assessments, and any other materials concerning Respondents’ compliance with related Provisions of this Order, for the compliance period covered by such System Assessment;
requirements.deadline: 5 years from each System Assessment's preparation date

requirements.description: Retain a copy of each widely disseminated and materially different representation describing the extent to which Respondents maintain or protect the privacy, security, availability, confidentiality, or integrity of any Covered Information, including any representation concerning a change in any website or other service relating to those topics.
requirements.quoted_text: F. A copy of each widely disseminated and materially different representation by Defendants that describes the extent to which Defendants maintains or protects the privacy, security, availability, confidentiality, or integrity of any Covered Information, including any representation concerning a change in any website or other service controlled by Respondents that relates to privacy, security, availability, confidentiality, or integrity of Covered Information;

requirements.description: For five (5) years after the date of preparation of each Assessment by the Assessor, retain all materials and evidence the Assessor considered, reviewed, relied upon, or examined to prepare the Assessment, including all plans, reports, studies, reviews, audits, audit trails, policies, training materials, and assessments.
requirements.quoted_text: G. For five (5) years after the date of preparation of each Assessment by the Assessor, as those terms are defined in Provision IX, all materials and evidence that the Assessor considered, reviewed, relied upon or examined to prepare the Assessment, whether prepared by or on behalf of Respondents, including all plans, reports, studies, reviews, audits, audit trails, policies, training materials, and assessments, and any other materials concerning compliance with related Provisions of this Order, for the compliance period covered by such Assessment;
requirements.deadline: 5 years from each Assessment's preparation date

requirements.description: For five (5) years from the date received, retain copies of all subpoenas and other communications with law enforcement, if such communications relate to Respondents' compliance with this Order.
requirements.quoted_text: H. For five (5) years from the date received, copies of all subpoenas and other communications with law enforcement, if such communications relate to Respondents’ compliance with this Order; and

requirements.description: For five (5) years from the date created or received, retain all records, whether prepared by or on behalf of a Respondent, that tend to show any lack of compliance by a Respondent with this Order.
requirements.quoted_text: I. For five (5) years from the date created or received, all records, whether prepared by or on behalf of a Respondent, that tend to show any lack of compliance by a Respondent with this Order.
requirements.deadline: 5 years from date created or received

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondents' compliance by requesting additional reports, conducting depositions, obtaining records, communicating directly with Respondents, interviewing affiliated individuals, and using all other lawful means including undercover operations.

requirements.description: Within fourteen (14) days of receipt of a written request from a Commission representative, each Respondent must submit additional compliance reports or other requested information (sworn under penalty of perjury), appear for depositions, and produce records for inspection and copying. The Commission is also authorized to obtain discovery using Federal Rules of Civil Procedure 29, 30, 31, 33, 34, 36, 45, and 69.
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within fourteen (14) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, each Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury; appear for 27 depositions; and produce records for inspection and copying. The Commission is also authorized to obtain discovery, without further leave of court, using any of the procedures prescribed by Federal Rules of Civil Procedure 29, 30 (including telephonic depositions), 31, 33, 34, 36, 45, and 69.

requirements.description: Respondents must permit representatives of the Commission to communicate directly with each Respondent and to interview anyone affiliated with any Respondent who has agreed to such an interview, with counsel present.
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with each Respondent. Respondents must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with any Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, without identification or prior notice, and may use compulsory process pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act.
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondents or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondents, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Modification of Original Decision and Order
provisions.summary: This Decision and Order supersedes the Commission's prior 2010 Decision and Order in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308.

requirements.description: This Decision and Order supersedes the Decision and Order the Commission previously issued in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308, 150 F.T.C. 694 (Nov. 12, 2010).
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Decision and Order supersedes the Decision and Order the Commission previously issued in In re Rite Aid Corporation, C-4308, 150 F.T.C. 694 (Nov. 12, 2010).

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: This Order is final and effective upon publication on ftc.gov and will terminate 20 years from the date of issuance, or 20 years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a federal court complaint alleging a violation of this Order, whichever is later, with specified exceptions.

requirements.description: This Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order, and will terminate twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance or twenty (20) years from the most recent date the United States or Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of this Order, whichever comes later, subject to specified exceptions.
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission’s seal), or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of this Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. This Order’s application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. This Order if such complaint is filed after the Order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that the Respondent did not violate any Provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such 28 complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission's seal), or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of this Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. Any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. This Order's application to any Respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. This Order if such complaint is filed after the Order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
